edu.uprb.datastructure

Class StackMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uprb.datastructure.StackMachine

  • public class StackMachine
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a stack machine. A stack machine is a type of computer which most of its instructions operate using a stack.
    Author:
    Luis J. Berríos Negrón

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  StackMachine.NotEnoughElementsException
      Used when the stack doesn't contain the required amount of elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[] data
      The elements stored in the stack.
      private int second
      The element stored just before the top of the stack.
      private int top
      The element stored at the top of the stack.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StackMachine()
      Construct a stack machine with an initial capacity of 10.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add()
      Add the top two elements of the stack and place the result at the top of the stack.
      private void checkEnoughElements()
      Check if the stack contains two elements or more.
      private void checkIsEmpty()
      Check if the stack is empty.
      void div()
      Divide the top element of the stack by the second element (top / second) and place the result at the top of the stack.
      private void ensureCapacity()
      Ensure the stack has enough capacity by doubling said capacity if necessary.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Check if there's an element at the top of the stack.
      void mult()
      Multiply the top two elements of the stack and place the result at the top of the stack.
      double peek()
      Return the element at the top of the stack without removing it.
      double pop()
      Remove the element at the top of stack and return it.
      void pow()
      Raise the second element of the stack to the power of the top element and place the result at the top of the stack.
      void push(double num)
      Push an element to the top of the stack.
      int size()
      Get the amount of elements stored in the stack.
      void sub()
      Subtract the top two elements of the stack (top - second) and place the result at the top of the stack.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Get the string representation of the stack.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        The elements stored in the stack.

        The element stored at the top of the stack.

        The element stored just before the top of the stack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StackMachine

        public StackMachine()
        Construct a stack machine with an initial capacity of 10.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(double num)
        Push an element to the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        num - The element to push

      • ensureCapacity

        private void ensureCapacity()
        Ensure the stack has enough capacity by doubling said capacity if necessary.

      • pop

        public double pop()
        Remove the element at the top of stack and return it.
        Returns:
        The element that was at the top of the stack

      • peek

        public double peek()
        Return the element at the top of the stack without removing it.
        Returns:
        The element at the top of the stack

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if there's an element at the top of the stack. If there isn't, then the stack is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the stack is empty, false if otherwise

      • add

        public void add()
        Add the top two elements of the stack and place the result at the top of the stack.

      • sub

        public void sub()
        Subtract the top two elements of the stack (top - second) and place the result at the top of the stack.

      • mult

        public void mult()
        Multiply the top two elements of the stack and place the result at the top of the stack.

      • div

        public void div()
        Divide the top element of the stack by the second element (top / second) and place the result at the top of the stack.

      • pow

        public void pow()
        Raise the second element of the stack to the power of the top element and place the result at the top of the stack.

      • checkEnoughElements

        private void checkEnoughElements()
        Check if the stack contains two elements or more. If not, throw a StackMachine.NotEnoughElementsException.

      • checkIsEmpty

        private void checkIsEmpty()
        Check if the stack is empty. If it is, throw a StackMachine.NotEnoughElementsException.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the amount of elements stored in the stack.
        Returns:
        The amount of elements stored in the stack

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the string representation of the stack.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The string representation of the stack
